subject: Science
title: How We See Inside Earth
description: A fast breakdown of How We See Inside Earth for builders.

hook.text: No drill has gone deeper than 12 km. Earth's center is 6,371 km down. How do we know?

buildup.text: Earthquake waves travel through Earth, bending and reflecting off each layer.

discovery.text: P-waves pass through solids and liquids. S-waves stop at liquids.

twist.text: S-waves disappear at the outer core â€” proof that it's liquid.

climax.text: By mapping thousands of earthquakes, scientists built an X-ray of Earth's interior.

punchline.text: We see inside Earth using earthquakes as flashlights.

quiz.question: How do scientists know Earth's outer core is liquid?
